title: PowerGlove
author: PowerGlove
created_time: August 31, 2022, 12:25:35 AMLast edit: August 31, 2022, 12:59:50 AM by PowerGlove
content: I'm guessing that there's an unexciting explanation for this, but I noticed an old post [1] that was authored by "Anonymous", but edited by Satoshi:Does anyone know what's up with that post?Maybe it's one of Satoshi's (although it's in a distinctly different style), but he didn't want his name attached to it?Maybe it's not his (more likely), but he edited it as a moderator? But then, why the edit? I'm not sure how moderation worked back then, but this post seems unlikely to have contained a spam link or anything objectionable.Any insights appreciated! [1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=237.msg1985#msg1985

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Satoshi was the creator/admin of the forum. Back in the day, people can post in the forum as "anonymous". No sign up was required if I'm correct. Satoshi added the post as administrator. I don't think there's anything special. Moderator may check what has been edited as they most likely has the right to check the original version of the post.

But this is the only example I could find (so far) of one edited by "satoshi", although I admit I haven't looked thoroughly/carefully.
